        <div data-target="readme-toc.content" class="Box-body px-5 pb-5">
          <article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><h1 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-archiveis" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#archiveis"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>archiveis</h1>
<p dir="auto">A simple Python wrapper for the <a href="http://archive.is/" rel="nofollow">archive.is</a> capturing service.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://github.com/pastpages/archiveis/workflows/Tests/badge.svg"><img src="https://github.com/pastpages/archiveis/workflows/Tests/badge.svg" alt="Tests" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-installation" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#installation"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Installation</h3>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pipenv install archiveis"><pre>pipenv install archiveis</pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-python-usage" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#python-usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Python Usage</h3>
<p dir="auto">Import it.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-python position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> import archiveis"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">archiveis</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Capture a URL.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-python position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> archive_url = archiveis.capture("http://www.example.com/")"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-s1">archive_url</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">archiveis</span>.<span class="pl-en">capture</span>(<span class="pl-s">"http://www.example.com/"</span>)</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">See where it's stored.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-python position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> print archive_url
https://archive.md/WxlRK"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-k">print</span> <span class="pl-s1">archive_url</span>
<span class="pl-s1">https</span>:<span class="pl-c1">//</span><span class="pl-s1">archive</span>.<span class="pl-s1">md</span><span class="pl-c1">/</span><span class="pl-v">WxlRK</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">If a URL has been recently cached, archive.is may return the URL to that page rather
than conduct a new capture.</p>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-command-line-usage" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#command-line-usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Command-line usage</h3>
<p dir="auto">The Python library is also installed as a command-line interface. You can run it from your terminal like so:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="archiveis http://www.example.com/"><pre>archiveis http://www.example.com/</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">The command has the same options as the Python API, which you can learn about from its help output.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ archiveis --help
Usage: archiveis [OPTIONS] URL

  Archives the provided URL using the archive.is capturing service.

Options:
  -ua, --user-agent TEXT  User-Agent header for the web request
  --help                  Show this message and exit."><pre>$ archiveis --help
Usage: archiveis [OPTIONS] URL

  Archives the provided URL using the archive.is capturing service.

Options:
  -ua, --user-agent TEXT  User-Agent header <span class="pl-k">for</span> the web request
  --help                  Show this message and exit.</pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-contributing" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#contributing"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Contributing</h3>
<p dir="auto">Install dependencies for development.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pipenv install --dev"><pre>pipenv install --dev</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Run tests.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="make test"><pre>make <span class="pl-c1">test</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Ship new version to PyPI</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="make ship"><pre>make ship</pre></div>
<h3 dir="auto"><a id="user-content-developing-the-cli" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#developing-the-cli"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Developing the CLI</h3>
<p dir="auto">The command-line interface is implemented using Click and setuptools. To install it locally for development inside your virtual environment, run the following installation command, as <a href="https://click.palletsprojects.com/en/7.x/setuptools/#setuptools-integration" rel="nofollow">prescribed by the Click documentation</a>.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pip install --editable ."><pre>pip install --editable <span class="pl-c1">.</span></pre></div>
</article>
        </div>
    </div>

readabilityObject.title: GitHub - palewire/archiveis: A simple Python wrapper for the archive.is capturing service
readabilityObject.content:
archiveis

A simple Python wrapper for the archive.is capturing service.

Installation

Python Usage

Import it.

Capture a URL.

>>> archive_url = archiveis.capture("http://www.example.com/")

See where it's stored.

>>> print archive_url
https://archive.md/WxlRK

If a URL has been recently cached, archive.is may return the URL to that page rather than conduct a new capture.

Command-line usage

The Python library is also installed as a command-line interface. You can run it from your terminal like so:

archiveis http://www.example.com/

The command has the same options as the Python API, which you can learn about from its help output.

$ archiveis --help
Usage: archiveis [OPTIONS] URL

  Archives the provided URL using the archive.is capturing service.

Options:
  -ua, --user-agent TEXT  User-Agent header for the web request
  --help                  Show this message and exit.

Contributing

Install dependencies for development.

Run tests.

Ship new version to PyPI

Developing the CLI

The command-line interface is implemented using Click and setuptools. To install it locally for development inside your virtual environment, run the following installation command, as prescribed by the Click documentation.
